positive.review:
These negative reviews make me feel smart. There are servers that allow character creation. Literally just pick a different datacenter if it says you can't make a character. Also to install the game on another drive, just.. pick a different drive when downloading it...? Like PLEASE tell me these people are trolling.

Anyways as for the review, A Realm Reborn story is a bit of a slog for the most part so I can understand getting bored of the game early on, but it's got some parts here and there that are fairly interesting and kept me interested. Classes/Jobs are all pretty cool. I like that each class/job has their own special mechanic unlike every other MMO where classes only change your skills. (Not to mention you can play every single class/job on a single character and swap whenever you feel like with 0 downsides). Also each class/job has their own stories which is cool. Game fun, but def not for everyone. Would give it a solid 6.5-7/10

The game is absolutely amazing, although the subscription does dishearten me.
I truly wonder about the features hidden behind it and would purchase it if I at least had a bit of a feel of what will be added, if there's any kind of rebate for subscribing long enough and so on.

Do not catch me wrong, the Free Trial goes a deep bit into the game, incl story and a lot of other features. But it feels so incomplete without being able to access at least my retainer or an own home.

I am more of a Gatherer personally and I would've loved to sample a little further, not being able to access the player market was no big ordeal for me because I was completely engrossed with where to get what, what to craft, what to do with it, level up by assisting my grand company, cooking various kinds of foods and discovering new materials as I proceed onwards.

It's so well made, especially for an MMO, props to the gents whom actually designed all of this and keep extending on it, I absolutely love it. 
The fact people can recognize stuff is HQ and different dialogue hits you. Capability of finding rare seeds and a whole flipping gardening system.. It's just made with some much passion and exactly that compartment of the game to be honest makes me wanna delve even deeper into it. 
As usual Square Enix got a W, and if I am not mistaken this team specifically was also tasked with making FF16 and honestly it fucking shows. Peak next to peak.
 Keep up the great work, I'll most likely still grab the sub due to my love to the series. And I saw the Cecil Harvey mention in the Options, my favorite FF of the past is and always will be FF4 x)

Pretty big learning curve for people who aren't usually into gaming. Once you get through the early gameplay stuff, the game starts to get fun! :D Overall, it can be overwhelming and kinda confusing at times, and there is ALWAYS a lot to learn, but its a fun game if you have the time to invest in it.

Amazing free trial with truly staggering amounts of content. It takes a bit to get into, but doing so is worth it. I've only played through the main storyline of A Realm Reborn, the first of the three free expansions, but did so much side content that the 50 or so hours of story lasted me to this point. Thank you Square Enix for giving this experience for free and thank you to the community for being so kind to new players

I have this game for PC/Playstation I  have been playing since 2019 and honestly this game was alot of fun over the years I made friends it is a great game and the developers care about the players and try to make the players happy always its a great way to make friends and have fun for sure. Plus you can play more than one class one  a single character and the classes are not gender locked like most games and the storyline is really good.
Game is fun and has a lot of content. But please fix the ddos, it leaves a bad first impression for new players.

The game has gambling, and its free.. maybe not forever but I'm milkin it... also the game has gambling
I enjoyed some early dungeon mechanics with my friends, strong character designs and gambling... the game really has an award winning story with all your favourite gambling prolific summons and classic household names in the final fantasy franchise. 

I'm just trying the dragoon class to start gambling my journey in a multiple highly dense and atmospheric world, several continents and unique regions gambling all with gambling some unbelievable soundtracks, really just great stuff 

Fishing has gambling been pretty exciting, i really enjoy how its kind of its own class, you gambling select your gear the same way and that will unlock your questlines and NPCs respectively 

Now the real piece de resistance for this whole thing so far... you got it its the chocobo life, racing, breeding, combat, feeding with your overstuffed and lovable chicken horse AND you cant really go to Gold Saucer without a quick peek at the various activities claw machine gambling the kind of place to help you unwind take a break from the intensities of being a warrior of CLAW light, lights and spectacle really just CLAW a gambling theatrics inspired environment with so many rewards and weekly GAMBLING thematic or seasonal rotating challenges

gambling

Have you heard of the critically acclaimed MMORPG Final Fantasy 14? With an expanded free trial which you can play through the entirety of a Realm Reborn and the award winning Heavensward, and thrilling Stormblood expansions up to level 70 for free with no restrictions on play time?
If you know what you're getting into and that the first chapters are a bit slow, you're in for a chill and rich MMO. Enjoying it so far.
it's ok i guess
i don't like this game
FFXIV my beloved
*Nods Stoically*
Obsessed.
Yes.

It's not really a "free trial", it's more a free version.

It's advertised in a really weird way, but basically, this gives you access to the main game + the first 2 expansions for ANY AMOUNT OF TIME (be it in game time or IRL time). This is literally hundreds if not thousands of hours of playtime.

The only downside is that you don't have access to some mostly social stuff (which is one of the reason why I moved to the full game), and selling/trading items to other players.


The fact that this is all advertised as a "trial" is really something. They actually *undersell* it.

These negative reviews make me feel smart. There are servers that allow character creation. Literally just pick a different datacenter if it says you can't make a character. Also to install the game on another drive, just.. pick a different drive when downloading it...? Like PLEASE tell me these people are trolling.

Anyways as for the review, A Realm Reborn story is a bit of a slog for the most part so I can understand getting bored of the game early on, but it's got some parts here and there that are fairly interesting and kept me interested. Classes/Jobs are all pretty cool. I like that each class/job has their own special mechanic unlike every other MMO where classes only change your skills. (Not to mention you can play every single class/job on a single character and swap whenever you feel like with 0 downsides). Also each class/job has their own stories which is cool. Game fun, but def not for everyone. Would give it a solid 6.5-7/10

I played this game off steam. Currently 600 hours into the free trail, and I am in love with this game. I JUST got the full game after 600 hours. PLEASE give this game a shot. Don't let anyone tell you ARR is bad and let that skew your views. Take the game at YOUR OWN PACE. It took me 600 hours to get through ARR, Heavensward, and Stormblood. The game has so much that is worth your time to explore, and I highly recommend that you do. It is peak, I fear.

Ngl, most of the negative reviews here come from stupid people who can't spend a single minute on troubleshooting, but the launcher is indeed garbage. It kept saying my password was somehow wrong, so then I clicked remmeber password and changed the password....to the same thing. Ctrl+c, ctrl+v no errors on my side. Then it finally let me log in. 

Game itself is fun so far, great music.
Great way to start up and experience FFXIV without the full commitment. Highly recommend.
I really enjoy this game, I love the main storyline, the combat, and the character customization. I highly recommend checking out this game
If you dont mind the few restrictions of the trial, you can get a shit ton of content out of it

The game is absolutely amazing, although the subscription does dishearten me.
I truly wonder about the features hidden behind it and would purchase it if I at least had a bit of a feel of what will be added, if there's any kind of rebate for subscribing long enough and so on.

Do not catch me wrong, the Free Trial goes a deep bit into the game, incl story and a lot of other features. But it feels so incomplete without being able to access at least my retainer or an own home.

I am more of a Gatherer personally and I would've loved to sample a little further, not being able to access the player market was no big ordeal for me because I was completely engrossed with where to get what, what to craft, what to do with it, level up by assisting my grand company, cooking various kinds of foods and discovering new materials as I proceed onwards.

It's so well made, especially for an MMO, props to the gents whom actually designed all of this and keep extending on it, I absolutely love it. 
The fact people can recognize stuff is HQ and different dialogue hits you. Capability of finding rare seeds and a whole flipping gardening system.. It's just made with some much passion and exactly that compartment of the game to be honest makes me wanna delve even deeper into it. 
As usual Square Enix got a W, and if I am not mistaken this team specifically was also tasked with making FF16 and honestly it fucking shows. Peak next to peak.
 Keep up the great work, I'll most likely still grab the sub due to my love to the series. And I saw the Cecil Harvey mention in the Options, my favorite FF of the past is and always will be FF4 x)

Best free trial of all sub-based MMO, only down-side is no pvp and limited social interactions but for the later you can ask people in any cities or in the party finder and they'll help you to either group up or whatever else you might need help with. Unfortunately no trading of any sort is allowed and the same goes for free companies.

The beginning of the game is... rough, but it does get better, like really good. The thing that got me hooked through ARR was the crafting which was refreshing for a MMO (gathering is also nice) and once you get near the end of the first expansion the game pretty much, jump in quality suddenly, no more being a delivery guy or at least not as much!

A very great way to get into this game imo. It really lets you get a feel of the game without having to spend any money on subscriptions. I first started this game 3 years ago, but the start of the game was very long and felt like i was getting nowhere, but i returned 5 months ago and decided to give it a second chance. Fell in love with it upon finishing A realm reborn, and stayed for Heavensward and Stormblood (which are too peak for anyone to miss out on) Love the variety of jobs and the community is very kind to new players. I've met so many great people during my time with this game.

Pretty big learning curve for people who aren't usually into gaming. Once you get through the early gameplay stuff, the game starts to get fun! :D Overall, it can be overwhelming and kinda confusing at times, and there is ALWAYS a lot to learn, but its a fun game if you have the time to invest in it.

Amazing free trial with truly staggering amounts of content. It takes a bit to get into, but doing so is worth it. I've only played through the main storyline of A Realm Reborn, the first of the three free expansions, but did so much side content that the 50 or so hours of story lasted me to this point. Thank you Square Enix for giving this experience for free and thank you to the community for being so kind to new players

I have this game for PC/Playstation I  have been playing since 2019 and honestly this game was alot of fun over the years I made friends it is a great game and the developers care about the players and try to make the players happy always its a great way to make friends and have fun for sure. Plus you can play more than one class one  a single character and the classes are not gender locked like most games and the storyline is really good.
Game is fun and has a lot of content. But please fix the ddos, it leaves a bad first impression for new players.
The free trial is very good, a work of art, Final Fantasy and it's world building pace is enjoyable. A great chance to stay committed to a good MMO. Some restrictions but it has a lot to offer.
perfect game for unemployed bums, ive been looking for a game like this. I DONT WANNA STOP ARRGHHHHHH

Imagine a MMORPG that is really fun, engaging, and open world.  Now remove the engaging.  Add time consuming,
That is FFXIV.
After 3000 hours in this game, I can proudly say it is a great game of running around and doing mindless quests.  It is also really fun in the aspect of killing story bosses only for them to have 4 additional phases.  A 2 minute fight turns into 16 minutes of slap the tank.
All in all, a fun game that makes you want to off yourself.

Edit 1: Great game to allow you to watch a video on the side because of multiple  4 min unskippable cut-scenes in the Dungeon: The Praetorium-  Est time to complete dungeon - 30 minutes   20 is cutscenes

Edit 2: Why tf is Minfilia always behind 3 fucking doors, that require another fucking instance.

Now the real piece de resistance for this whole thing so far... you got it its the chocobo life, racing, breeding, combat, feeding with your overstuffed and lovable chicken horse AND you cant really go to Gold Saucer without a quick peek at the various activities claw machine gambling the kind of place to help you unwind take a break from the intensities of being a warrior of CLAW light, lights and spectacle really just CLAW a gambling theatrics inspired environment with so many rewards and weekly GAMBLING thematic or seasonal rotating challenges

gambling

It's a slow burn, but if you're into MMOs, it's worth it.

The 100 hours playtime you see is the time it took me to get through the majority of the pre-expansion content. For about half of that, I was largely just riding on nostalgia for older WoW-style MMOs based around getting pointed between quest markers and navigating a swarm of hotkeys.

But for the second half of that playtime, something clicked in the narrative. Characters that I took for granted developed in personality as their appearances recurred, the high presentation value of the story really stuck, and the game began to really push your knowledge of the relatively simple mechanics in it's solo-only story segments. Going into the post-basegame, pre-expansion content, I especially appreciated how layered and mature the story is, unlike GW2's tendencies to forget the world of past stories once you're finished there, or ESO's embarrassingly children's book approach where characters baby you through their stories.

I went into FFXIV extremely sceptical, being a fan of those two MMOs. And sure, ESO still is the most enticing in it's vast level-scaled world and freedom to explore it at your will. And GW2's MMO combat is still absolutely second to none. But never in an MMO have I been as captivated by it's story as what I've experienced in FFXIV. And I haven't even reached Heavensward yet, where I hear the story only continues to get more and more memorable.

So yeah, I summarise this review just as I began it - if you're an MMO fan, no matter your background, give this a shot. If you fall off here and there, that's fine - I've been on this trial for at least a year already, maybe even two. But if you have the time to stick with it, it will stick.

Have you heard of the critically acclaimed MMORPG Final Fantasy 14? With an expanded free trial which you can play through the entirety of a Realm Reborn and the award winning Heavensward, and thrilling Stormblood expansions up to level 70 for free with no restrictions on play time?

There are a lot of things to do, even in the free trial.  Very fun and a great community.

I haven't done Heavensward yet and I've got a few thousand hours in.
If you know what you're getting into and that the first chapters are a bit slow, you're in for a chill and rich MMO. Enjoying it so far.
Very good game gives you ARR + 2 expansion packs for free.

It's a slow burn, but if you're into MMOs, it's worth it.

The 100 hours playtime you see is the time it took me to get through the majority of the pre-expansion content. For about half of that, I was largely just riding on nostalgia for older WoW-style MMOs based around getting pointed between quest markers and navigating a swarm of hotkeys.

But for the second half of that playtime, something clicked in the narrative. Characters that I took for granted developed in personality as their appearances recurred, the high presentation value of the story really stuck, and the game began to really push your knowledge of the relatively simple mechanics in it's solo-only story segments. Going into the post-basegame, pre-expansion content, I especially appreciated how layered and mature the story is, unlike GW2's tendencies to forget the world of past stories once you're finished there, or ESO's embarrassingly children's book approach where characters baby you through their stories.

I went into FFXIV extremely sceptical, being a fan of those two MMOs. And sure, ESO still is the most enticing in it's vast level-scaled world and freedom to explore it at your will. And GW2's MMO combat is still absolutely second to none. But never in an MMO have I been as captivated by it's story as what I've experienced in FFXIV. And I haven't even reached Heavensward yet, where I hear the story only continues to get more and more memorable.

So yeah, I summarise this review just as I began it - if you're an MMO fan, no matter your background, give this a shot. If you fall off here and there, that's fine - I've been on this trial for at least a year already, maybe even two. But if you have the time to stick with it, it will stick.

negative.review: After 60 hours of running around the map quest chasing hoping for things to improve, I gave up after someone in game. ( I can't remember his name) sent me to get him some Cheese. I gave the game a good go and eventually I thought Bollocks go and get your own bloody cheese. I just found it repetitive and boring.

My boyfriend and I were looking for an action MMORPG to play together. Wanted to try this demo before leaping in and paying for fhe game plus the subscription... Only to find out that in the demo, you can't be in party with others or even add people to your friends list. Uninstall led right away. We weren't about to spend 30 days testing out a game to play together.. without being able to play together or even in party with others.

But the 30min we did play: gameplay seemed smooth. Graphics were pretty. I like the choice of races. Didn't get past the starter zone though, killing lvl 4 monsters

[h1]FF14 Online is a complicated love hate relationship.[/h1]
There are very many things about ff14 that are good and equally as many that are bad. The free trial is the base game & first few dlc expansions for free with your character level being paywall subscription blocked at level 70. Whatever you do, don't pay anything until you have fully completed all free content story and mission wise first before subscribing. As once your character is considered a paid one you will be permanently locked out of it once your monthly membership expires!!!!
[h2]The Good.[/h2]
Overall the gameplay for the dungeons, raids, class variety, weapon variety, anti-monetization needed for the free trial and the full amount content available for completely free is pretty good. It will take you a ton of time to burn through all that on its own. The visuals are also very good with a pretty art style for being a free game. Apparently the modding community is very great in this game and is more than half the reason people even buy monthly subscriptions just to continue playing this. But where this game truly shines is the social aspect while using said feature. That truly is the peak of what ff14 can be.
[h2]The Bad... [/h2]
The story sucks until you hit the free dlc additions included in the trial. All the missions get extremely repetitive. You will be slapped relentlessly with basic enemy swarm fights missions, nonstop character yapping, an ungodly amount of fetch quests required to do previously said fun group content. The main missions in the base game are just insanely bad and just completely mind numbing. The missions in the dlc expansions that are included are still  mostly the same gameplay wise but at least there is a better variety and the story gets somewhat interesting at that point. You are forced to reunlock the ability to fly on your mount in every single area which gets irritating. Despite having a good amount of different classes the tanks and healers especially need more updates to not need such spammy playstyles in order to be more viable certain classes especially. Honestly the game also could use a system that allows more of a unique build selection rather than the current system. Also it takes way too long in order to rush through the game for a realistic sane person that may just want to catch up or play with their friends. And the good modding systems mentioned previously apparently got shut down which made a lot of people stop playing for awhile. But speaking of the community some people are great and some are complete degenerates in both a good and bad way so be careful or your likely to get harassed and stalked by some creepy lizard men (lizard people are usually the freakiest I don't make the rules.) Also you cannot dm to talk to people unless your a paid temporary membership member which genuinely is both good and bad in itself for preventing bots spamming chat, sadly that harms normal players social experience as this is best played as a social game with great group content late game wise.
[h2]Final conclusion.[/h2]
FF14 is a 50/50 on whether it actually is fully good or bad in itself. Very much so in each direction of the spectrum. invest your own time at your own risk and remember two rules. Be careful around the lizard people & don't pay until you have completed everything in the base game assuming your willing to lock your hundreds of hours of played content behind a hostage held monthly paywall.

I was just trying to play the free trial, but ran into launcher issues that, apparently, the MOST POPULAR MMORPG still hasn't been able to fix after all these years. I keep getting a download error and can't even log into my account. When I try to log into the website for the free trial, it tells me my account can't be used for it (why? I went to Reddit for help, but it seems like nobody cares about issues like this and my post asking for help just got downvoted into oblivion. So now I'm stuck in this situation where the game is actively pushing me away as a new player and won’t even let me in. Sorry, but that's just awful.

I gave the game a good go and eventually I thought Bollocks go and get your own bloody cheese. I just found it repetitive and boring.

My boyfriend and I were looking for an action MMORPG to play together. Wanted to try this demo before leaping in and paying for fhe game plus the subscription... Only to find out that in the demo, you can't be in party with others or even add people to your friends list. Uninstall led right away. We weren't about to spend 30 days testing out a game to play together.. without being able to play together or even in party with others.

But the 30min we did play: gameplay seemed smooth. Graphics were pretty. I like the choice of races. Didn't get past the starter zone though, killing lvl 4 monsters

Very good, but there's a game-breaking issue black screen at start-up for a good number of people. If you get a black screen at start-up here's a workaround / fix that worked for me:

1. Open launcher using Steam
2. Login, Don't click play yet
3. Open Task Manager
4. Find the Steam ( 32-bit ) process in the list under background processes (NOT the client service)
5. Close Steam 32 bit
6. Click Play now

And it should work, [strike]however Steam won't track your hours anymore[/strike] - but at least you get past the black screen.

EDIT: Doing this method once fixes the issue completely for me, no need to keep doing at every launch like first thought but it seems like this might be different for different people.

Square Enix fix your shit please.

[h1]FF14 Online is a complicated love hate relationship.[/h1]
There are very many things about ff14 that are good and equally as many that are bad. The free trial is the base game & first few dlc expansions for free with your character level being paywall subscription blocked at level 70. Whatever you do, don't pay anything until you have fully completed all free content story and mission wise first before subscribing. As once your character is considered a paid one you will be permanently locked out of it once your monthly membership expires!!!!
[h2]The Good.[/h2]
Overall the gameplay for the dungeons, raids, class variety, weapon variety, anti-monetization needed for the free trial and the full amount content available for completely free is pretty good. It will take you a ton of time to burn through all that on its own. The visuals are also very good with a pretty art style for being a free game. Apparently the modding community is very great in this game and is more than half the reason people even buy monthly subscriptions just to continue playing this. But where this game truly shines is the social aspect while using said feature. That truly is the peak of what ff14 can be.
[h2]The Bad... [/h2]
The story sucks until you hit the free dlc additions included in the trial. All the missions get extremely repetitive. You will be slapped relentlessly with basic enemy swarm fights missions, nonstop character yapping, an ungodly amount of fetch quests required to do previously said fun group content. The main missions in the base game are just insanely bad and just completely mind numbing. The missions in the dlc expansions that are included are still  mostly the same gameplay wise but at least there is a better variety and the story gets somewhat interesting at that point. You are forced to reunlock the ability to fly on your mount in every single area which gets irritating. Despite having a good amount of different classes the tanks and healers especially need more updates to not need such spammy playstyles in order to be more viable certain classes especially. Honestly the game also could use a system that allows more of a unique build selection rather than the current system. Also it takes way too long in order to rush through the game for a realistic sane person that may just want to catch up or play with their friends. And the good modding systems mentioned previously apparently got shut down which made a lot of people stop playing for awhile. But speaking of the community some people are great and some are complete degenerates in both a good and bad way so be careful or your likely to get harassed and stalked by some creepy lizard men (lizard people are usually the freakiest I don't make the rules.) Also you cannot dm to talk to people unless your a paid temporary membership member which genuinely is both good and bad in itself for preventing bots spamming chat, sadly that harms normal players social experience as this is best played as a social game with great group content late game wise.
[h2]Final conclusion.[/h2]
FF14 is a 50/50 on whether it actually is fully good or bad in itself. Very much so in each direction of the spectrum. invest your own time at your own risk and remember two rules. Be careful around the lizard people & don't pay until you have completed everything in the base game assuming your willing to lock your hundreds of hours of played content behind a hostage held monthly paywall.
You can't even start the game because the "accept terms and conditions" button stays grayed out even when you agree to the tos

I would have played this trial a lot sooner if they did not pay wall the only race I was interested in playing as. lets just say I found a way to have fun despite this...  I cant say for sure if ill keep playing once I get to level 70 from what I understand there are a lot of problems with the way the game is run. BUT for now I am enjoying it.

so an old account that never bought anything cannot play this trial at all, without warning or a way to unlink from steam...

Installing was a process itself, not being able to choose where to install ff14 without opening a third-party app is RIDICULOUS. Then, I go to make my character and NOT A SINGLE WORLD in the NA data center was allowing new character creation. I am SO ecstatic that I did not drop $20. If anyone has a way around this WITHOUT using other data centers lmk.

I know this is the free trial, but I did not want to buy the full game again to leave this review. I am a long time player since Heavensward and have a total of 2940 days subscribed (8 years). I have every job at max level including crafting classes, I have put in an ungodly amount of hours into this game, but I cannot recommend it nowadays.

The game is slowly becoming worse and worse with every expansion. In particular, job design and balance is atrocious. At first, it was the Summoner class that got reworked, all the complicated parts of the rotation were deleted and replaced with the easiest and most boring rotation in the game big summon -> crystals -> big summon. Then they reworked Black Mage, a class that had a simple standard rotation, but could be made infinitely more complicated using non-standard lines (for a mere 1%-2% dps increase) this was unacceptable for Square Enix who obliterated the class and made only standard rotations possible, they also removed enochian upkeep so you don't even have to think anymore. Of course the newly added classes follow this new job design shift, with Reaper being incredibly easy to play, but unbelievably boring, and Pictomancer being so easy you can play it with your eyes closed.

Additionally, all jobs are slowly moving towards a 1-2-3 rotation, where you press 3 buttons over and over and over and over. Healers on the other hand have a 1-1-1-1-1-1-1-1-2 rotation where they spam 1 button over and over and over because healers are required to damage in FFXIV to clear dps checks and so it's optimal not to heal, but focus on your dps "rotation" instead. This makes healing a massive chore as you spend the entire fight pressing 1 button.

Onto job balance, Square Enix failed miserably to balance Pictomancer, the new caster DPS job introduced in Dawntrail. It was so bad that Pictomancer was dealing almost 10% more damage than every other job, whilst also providing massive utility for the party such as damage negation and damage buffs and being safe from damage due to being ranged. How long did it take Square Enix to balance the job? over 4 months. For 4 months it was the dominant caster class, making every other class redundant. It was so overpowered that Pictomancers were capable of taking aggro completely off of a tank despite tanks having a bonus to aggro generation.

The game has gone so far downhill that my entire clan has left the game, only logging in now and then to prevent automatic house demolition since we can't forget the memories we made on here. I'll never forgive Square Enix for what they've done with FFXIV. I have so many fond memories of playing it and now it's all been ruined.

But the 30min we did play: gameplay seemed smooth. Graphics were pretty. I like the choice of races. Didn't get past the starter zone though, killing lvl 4 monsters

Very good, but there's a game-breaking issue black screen at start-up for a good number of people. If you get a black screen at start-up here's a workaround / fix that worked for me:

1. Open launcher using Steam
2. Login, Don't click play yet
3. Open Task Manager
4. Find the Steam ( 32-bit ) process in the list under background processes (NOT the client service)
5. Close Steam 32 bit
6. Click Play now

And it should work, [strike]however Steam won't track your hours anymore[/strike] - but at least you get past the black screen.

EDIT: Doing this method once fixes the issue completely for me, no need to keep doing at every launch like first thought but it seems like this might be different for different people.

Square Enix fix your shit please.

Talking to their support is about as much fun as that.

[h1]FF14 Online is a complicated love hate relationship.[/h1]
There are very many things about ff14 that are good and equally as many that are bad. The free trial is the base game & first few dlc expansions for free with your character level being paywall subscription blocked at level 70. Whatever you do, don't pay anything until you have fully completed all free content story and mission wise first before subscribing. As once your character is considered a paid one you will be permanently locked out of it once your monthly membership expires!!!!
[h2]The Good.[/h2]
Overall the gameplay for the dungeons, raids, class variety, weapon variety, anti-monetization needed for the free trial and the full amount content available for completely free is pretty good. It will take you a ton of time to burn through all that on its own. The visuals are also very good with a pretty art style for being a free game. Apparently the modding community is very great in this game and is more than half the reason people even buy monthly subscriptions just to continue playing this. But where this game truly shines is the social aspect while using said feature. That truly is the peak of what ff14 can be.
[h2]The Bad... [/h2]
The story sucks until you hit the free dlc additions included in the trial. All the missions get extremely repetitive. You will be slapped relentlessly with basic enemy swarm fights missions, nonstop character yapping, an ungodly amount of fetch quests required to do previously said fun group content. The main missions in the base game are just insanely bad and just completely mind numbing. The missions in the dlc expansions that are included are still  mostly the same gameplay wise but at least there is a better variety and the story gets somewhat interesting at that point. You are forced to reunlock the ability to fly on your mount in every single area which gets irritating. Despite having a good amount of different classes the tanks and healers especially need more updates to not need such spammy playstyles in order to be more viable certain classes especially. Honestly the game also could use a system that allows more of a unique build selection rather than the current system. Also it takes way too long in order to rush through the game for a realistic sane person that may just want to catch up or play with their friends. And the good modding systems mentioned previously apparently got shut down which made a lot of people stop playing for awhile. But speaking of the community some people are great and some are complete degenerates in both a good and bad way so be careful or your likely to get harassed and stalked by some creepy lizard men (lizard people are usually the freakiest I don't make the rules.) Also you cannot dm to talk to people unless your a paid temporary membership member which genuinely is both good and bad in itself for preventing bots spamming chat, sadly that harms normal players social experience as this is best played as a social game with great group content late game wise.
[h2]Final conclusion.[/h2]
FF14 is a 50/50 on whether it actually is fully good or bad in itself. Very much so in each direction of the spectrum. invest your own time at your own risk and remember two rules. Be careful around the lizard people & don't pay until you have completed everything in the base game assuming your willing to lock your hundreds of hours of played content behind a hostage held monthly paywall.
